description: Binary logistic regression with scaling; returns predictions and probabilities
code:
def execute(testData):
    import numpy as np
    from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
    from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

    X_train = np.array(testData.get("features", []))
    y_train = np.array(testData.get("labels", []))
    X_test = np.array(testData.get("testFeatures", []))

    scaler = StandardScaler()
    X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

    model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
    model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

    X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)
    preds = model.predict(X_test_scaled).tolist()
    probs = model.predict_proba(X_test_scaled)[:, 1].tolist()

    return {
        "success": True,
        "predictions": preds,
        "probabilities": probs,
        "train_accuracy": float(model.score(X_train_scaled, y_train))
    }
